sentence.Network_en: Next day the EU summit strengthened their ultimatum.
sentence.Network_cn: 次日，欧盟峰会发出了更加强硬的最后通牒。

sentence.Network_en: He gave me an ultimatum: either Tom had to leave, or me.
sentence.Network_cn: 他向我发出了最后通牒: 不是汤姆离开, 就是我离开.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: from Latin, neuter past participle of ultimare 'come to an end'

entry.def: An ultimatum is a warning to someone that unless they act in a particular way, action will be taken against them.

example.ex: They issued an ultimatum to the police to rid an area of racist attackers, or they will take the law into their own hands.
example.tran: 他们向警方发出了最后通牒，要求肃清整个地区的种族主义暴徒，否则他们将自行采取行动。
期限为48小时的最后通牒

sentences.cn: 他向我发出了最后通牒：不是汤姆离开, 就是我离开。

jushi.english: He gave his daughter an ultimatum: unless she stopped taking drugs he would throw her out of the house.
jushi.chinese: 他给女儿下了最后通牒：她要是不戒毒，他就把她从家里赶出去。
